What does a global moderator do compared to a normal moderator?

Why are [@MarkZero](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/104427-markzero/), [@Miiku87](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/132440-miiku87/), and [@nicolez](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/132445-nicolez/) listed in the Moderators portion of the Staff page? I know they're from Kerbal EDU, but I think you should maybe change them to their own category so people don't get confused.

Ethanadams, for one thing, globals are more senior moderators, and so policy questions or tie-breaker calls within the team are passed up to them. Rank within the team is rather informal, but *somebody* needs to be in charge. Also, most of the globals have access to admin powers on the forum. 

Dman979, actually, our moderator role charts are very out of date. We know about it, but to be honest, we mostly haven't updated because it would include the sad duty of removing the names of some people who have moved on, such as KasperVld and a few of the guys who are preoccupied with school or day jobs right now. ![:(](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_sad.gif ":(") Perhaps after the new CM gets settled in.
